description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: People v. Taylor
**판결일**: 2001-12-03
**법원**: California Supreme Court
**관할**: California, CA

**판사**: Chin

## 인용

- 34 P.3d 937
- 113 Cal. Rptr. 2d 827
- 26 Cal. 4th 1155

## 판결문 요약


113 Cal. Rptr. 2d 827 (2001)
26 Cal. 4th 1155
34 P.3d 937
The PEOPLE, Plaintiff and Respondent,
v.
Robert Clarence TAYLOR, Defendant and Appellant.
No. S025121.
Supreme Court of California.
December 3, 2001.
Rehearing Denied January 29, 2002.
*831 Susan K. Marr, under appointment by the Supreme Court, Brentwood, TN, for Defendant and Appellant.
Bill Lockyer, Attorney General, David P. Druliner, Chief Assistant Attorney General, Gary W. Schons, Assistant Attorney General, Garrett Beaumont and Carl H. Horst, Deputy Attorneys General, for Plaintiff and Respondent.
*832 CHIN, J.
Defendant Robert Clarence Taylor appeals from a judgment of the Orange County Superior Court imposing the death penalty following his conviction of first degree murder (Pen.Code, § 187),[1] attempted murder (§§ 664, 187), burglary (§ 459), and two counts of robbery (§ 211), accompanied by a special circumstance finding that he committed the murder while engaged in the commission of a burglary and robbery (§ 190.2, former subd. (a)(17)(i), (vii) [now subd. (a)(17)(A), (G)]), and an additional finding that he personally used a firearm during these crimes. Defendant's appeal is automatic. (§ 1239, subd. (b).) As will appear, we conclude we should affirm the judgment in its entirety.

I. FACTS
Defendant Taylor, together with codefendants James Norman DeWitt and Nanette Scheid (see People v. Scheid (1997) 16 Cal. 4th 1, 65 Cal. Rptr. 2d 348, 939 P.2d 748 (Scheid), involving the separate appeal of this codefen...
